Turbulence and Fluid Dynamics.2510.25636: |**2025-10-29**|**Observations of the Relationship between Magnetic Anisotropy and Mode Composition in Low-$β$ Solar Wind Turbulence**|Chuanpeng Hou|astro-ph.SR; physics.plasm-ph; physics.space-ph|[2510.25636](http://arxiv.org/abs/2510.25636)|10 Pages, 8 Figures|Turbulence is a ubiquitous process that transfers energy across many spatial and temporal scales, thereby influencing particle transport and heating.
